title: WCAS PORT 115-2-20 Portuguese for Spanish Speakers

descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value: Portuguese 115-2 is the sequence of Portuguese 115-1. The course deepens concepts and usage of Portuguese in comparison and contrast to Spanish - or other Romance Languages. Emphasis on socio-linguistic and an interactive approach to develop an intercultural communicative competence that targets pronunciation, intonation, and sentence structure in patterns of spoken and written Portuguese. The course also highlights sociological and historical aspects of Portuguese speaking countries other than Brazil.

descriptions.name: Learning Objectives
descriptions.value:
? To emphasize the development of written and spoken Brazilian Portuguese as the foundation for advanced training in the 4 skills in the language (listening, speaking, reading and writing);
? To achieve an Intermediate language skill level (based upon on the ACTFL Proficiency Guidelines, 2012) that will focus on the development of the intercultural communicative competence in Portuguese;
? To deepen vocabulary, grammar and discursive skills at the intermediate language level;
? To offer insights into the history and culture of the Portuguese speaking countries of Europe, Africa and America.
? Topics covered: Health, Housing, History and work in the Luso-african society.
